noun.description: A poem or song narrating a story in short stanzas. Traditional ballads are typically of unknown authorship, having been passed on orally from one generation to the next as part of the folk culture.

origin: Late 15th century (denoting a light, simple song): from Old French balade, from Provençal balada dance, song to dance to, from balar to dance, from late Latin ballare (see ball). The sense narrative poem dates from the mid 18th century.
